Create a plugin for items of type coolthing. Create a documentation page, [[About CoolThing Plugin]], that includes an example of a coolthing.
<h3> Files
A common configuration is to make a FedWiki directory that contains clones of any repos in use during development. Download the gist to this directory.
This will create a plugin for items of type coolthing. Create a documentation page, [[About CoolThing Plugin]], that includes an example of a coolthing.

Package:    cd wiki-plugin-coolthing/
Install:    npm install
Build:      grunt build; grunt watch
Publish:    npm link; (cd ../wiki-node; npm link wiki-plugin-coolthing)
Server:     (restart once to notice new plugin)
Browse:     open localhost:3000/about-coolthing-plugin.html
Develop:    vi client/coolthing.coffee
Commit:     git init; git add .; git commit

Publish the new plugin locally using symbolic links. One command makes the package available, another adds it to the server's plugins.

Commit the generated files and your improvements to a local git repository.
<h3> Publication
If you make a GitHub repo by the same name then it is easy to publish your code with two git commands that they will suggest.
If you make an npm module by the same name then you can publish your module following their instructions.
As a published npm module other federated wiki server operators can offer your plugin by adding one like to their packages.json file.
As a published npm module with continued support you are welcome to request your module be included in the package.json included in the npm module 'wiki'. [https://github/fedwiki/wiki-node github]
